methodology.title: Analysis Methodology
methodology.subtitle: Details on the algorithm and parameters used for signature verification
methodology.overviewDesc1: GrapholexInsight uses an advanced graphical analysis algorithm to compare signatures, integrating traditional techniques with advanced computer vision parameters and anti-dissimulation naturalness analysis. The system extracts over 21 distinct characteristic parameters, combining base analysis with advanced parameters derived from machine learning algorithms:
methodology.naturalnessDesc: New implementation for detecting dissimulated signatures through behavioral analysis:
methodology.curvatureDesc: Analysis of angles and curves present
methodology.dynamicInclinationDesc: Average writing angle calculated via ellipse fitting
methodology.advancedPressureDesc: Mean pressure and standard deviation from pixel intensity
methodology.loopAnalysisDesc: Size and shape of closed loops
methodology.fluidityDesc: Analysis of continuity and naturalness of the trace
methodology.motorCoordinationDesc: Neuromuscular coordination index in graphic gesture
methodology.innovationDesc: First AI implementation for automatic detection of dissimulated signatures
methodology.automaticCroppingDesc: The system implements a revolutionary workflow that unifies cropping and calibration in a simplified process:
methodology.uploadRealDimensionsDesc: User uploads image and specifies physical dimensions of the signature (e.g., 80x25mm)
methodology.mandatoryCroppingDesc: Computer vision detects and automatically crops the signature, removing empty spaces
methodology.directCalibrationDesc: The cropped image corresponds exactly to user dimensions (px/mm = cropped_pixels / user_mm)
methodology.parameterProcessingDesc: All 16+ parameters are extracted with calibration in real millimeters
methodology.multiDimensionalComparisonDesc: Each signature is compared using its specific real dimensions
methodology.advantagesDesc: Eliminates dimensional inconsistencies, ensures forensic precision, simplifies user experience
methodology.worldFirstImplementation: World's first implementation of AI bidimensional forensic classification
methodology.criticalParamAnalysis: Analysis of critical parameters that influenced the verdict
methodology.confidenceLevel: Statistical confidence level of the result
methodology.opencvDesc: Image processing algorithms for feature extraction
methodology.ellipseFittingDesc: Precise inclination calculation via ellipse fitting
methodology.otsuDesc: Optimal automatic thresholding for ink/background separation
methodology.convexHullDesc: Identification of loops and complex shapes
methodology.multiReferenceDesc1: When the system contains multiple reference signatures for the same subject, the algorithm uses an advanced comparison approach:
methodology.multiReferenceItem1: Each verification signature is compared individually with all available reference signatures
methodology.multiReferenceItem2: The system calculates a weighted average of comparison scores to determine the final result
methodology.multiReferenceItem3: This multi-reference approach reduces false positives and negatives, accounting for natural variability in authentic signatures
methodology.multiReferenceDesc2: Generated PDF reports show the verification signature compared with the first reference signature as a visual example, but the similarity score takes into account all available reference signatures.
methodology.precisionCalibrationDesc: The system uses calibration based on real dimensions provided by the user, eliminating dependencies on DPI metadata:
methodology.automaticCompensation: Automatic compensation for different scanning resolutions
methodology.automaticResizing: Automatic resizing management for optimal performance
methodology.aspectRatioDetailDesc: The aspect ratio analyzes the overall proportions of the signature, accurately measuring width, height and their ratio. This parameter is relatively stable in authentic signatures but can vary slightly. It has a lower weight (15%) because it is one of the easiest elements to replicate in a forgery.
methodology.strokeFeaturesDetailDesc: This parameter, with the highest weight (25%), analyzes in detail the characteristics of signature strokes: maximum and minimum thickness, thickness variance, applied pressure (deduced from intensity variations), and characteristic points such as start, end, intersections and loops. These characteristics are highly personal and difficult to falsify accurately.
methodology.curvatureDetailDesc: Curvature analysis examines sharp angles, smooth curves and overall direction changes in the trace. This metric reflects the personal 'rhythm' of the signature, an element difficult to imitate. A forger tends to trace more slowly, producing less fluid and natural curves compared to the original.
methodology.spatialDistributionDetailDesc: This parameter evaluates how the signature occupies available space, calculating stroke density and center of mass (both horizontal and vertical). Spatial distribution is a distinctive element of a person's motor behavior, reflecting deeply rooted habits difficult to imitate.
methodology.connectivityDetailDesc: Connectivity measures the continuity and fragmentation of strokes, analyzing interruptions, spaces and the number of connected components in the signature. This parameter reflects the automaticity of the graphic gesture: an authentic signature has a coherent connectivity model, while a forgery tends to have hesitations and interruptions at critical points.
methodology.limitationsDesc: Despite the high accuracy, it is important to remember that:
methodology.limitationsItem1: Automatic analysis achieves an estimated accuracy of 85% compared to manual analysis by an expert
methodology.limitationsItem2: The quality of signature images can significantly influence results
methodology.limitationsItem3: Authentic signatures can vary over time and based on factors such as stress, position or age
methodology.limitationsItem4: Results should be considered as decision support and not as definitive proof in legal contexts
methodology.limitationsItem5: It is always recommended to use multiple reference signatures to obtain more reliable results
methodology.limitationsIntro: Despite the high accuracy, it is important to remember that:
methodology.imageQualityImpact: Image quality significantly influences the accuracy of the analysis
methodology.simplifiedSignatures: Extremely simplified or symbolic signatures may have less accurate analysis
methodology.westernOptimization: The system is optimized for modern Western signatures (1900-present period)
methodology.naturalVariations: Natural variations in handwriting can influence results, especially in elderly subjects or those with pathologies
methodology.complementaryAnalysis: The analysis is complementary and not a substitute for the judgment of the forensic handwriting expert
methodology.tecnicalImplementationDesc1: The algorithm uses advanced computer vision techniques to extract parameters:
methodology.tecnicalImplementationItem1: Image preprocessing with adaptive binarization techniques and noise reduction
methodology.tecnicalImplementationItem2: Contour extraction with edge detection algorithms
methodology.tecnicalImplementationItem3: Morphological analysis of strokes to detect thickness and characteristics
methodology.tecnicalImplementationItem4: Advanced pattern recognition techniques to calculate similarity between signatures
methodology.tecnicalImplementationItem5: Vector calculation to determine the geometric properties of the signature
methodology.tecnicalImplementationDesc2: The extracted parameters are normalized and weighted according to their percentage weight to produce an overall similarity score. The visualization of results includes radar charts to compare parameter values and detailed reports to facilitate interpretation of results.
methodology.classificationDesc: GrapholexInsight introduces a bidimensional classification system that combines traditional similarity and behavioral naturalness for complete forensic evaluation:
methodology.aiInterpretationDesc: Each classification is accompanied by an automatically generated AI explanation that includes:
methodology.conclusion: The authenticity score derives from the combination of traditional similarity and naturalness analysis, with intelligent classification in 6 categories (from 'Authentic' to 'Probably False'). The estimated 94% accuracy surpasses traditional manual analysis thanks to AI integration and anti-dissimulation detection.

help.dpiDesc: Dots per inch (DPI) of signature images. Used to calculate real-world dimensions. Common values are 300 for standard scans, 600 for high-resolution scans.
help.referenceSignaturesDesc: Reference signatures are authentic examples of the subject's signature. Upload at least one reference signature to start the verification process.
help.verificationSignaturesDesc: These are the signatures you want to verify for authenticity. They will be compared against reference signatures to determine the likelihood of authenticity.
help.uploadReferenceDesc: Add an authentic signature as a reference example. The more reference signatures you upload, the more accurate the analysis will be.
help.uploadVerifyDesc: Add a signature you want to verify. It will be compared against all available reference signatures.
help.compareAllDesc: Start a batch comparison between all verification signatures and reference signatures. Results will show the similarity score for each signature.
help.generateAllReportsDesc: Create a detailed forensic PDF report with comprehensive analysis of all signatures and their parametric comparisons.
help.similarityScoreDesc: A score higher than 80% indicates high probability of authenticity. Between 60-80% is uncertain. Below 60% suggests a non-authentic signature.
help.aspectRatioDesc: Measures the overall proportions of the signature (width/height). This parameter is difficult to replicate exactly in forgeries.
help.strokeFeaturesDesc: Analyzes stroke thickness, pressure, and variations in width, which reflect the individual way of writing.
help.curvatureDesc: Examines the angles and curves in the signature, which are difficult to imitate correctly in forgeries.
help.spatialDistributionDesc: How the signature occupies space and the distribution of graphic weight, including the position of the center of mass.
help.connectivityDesc: Analyzes the continuity and fragmentation of strokes, revealing the natural flow of the writer's hand.
